citation.article-title: Thermotalea metallivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a thermophilic, anaerobic bacterium from the Great Artesian Basin of Australia aquifer.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thermotalea (Ther.mo.ta′le.a. Gr. adj. thermos hot; L. fem. n. talea a slender staff, rod; N.L. fem. n. Thermotalea a rod-shaped thermophile).
Cells are strictly anaerobic, slightly curved rods.
Fe(III), Mn(IV) and elemental sulfur are reduced.
16S rRNA gene analysis indicates that the genus is a member of the family Clostridiaceae and is most closely related to the genus Geosporobacter with sequence similarities of 89.9 %.
The type species is Thermotalea metallivorans.
